page.title: 15A Typical Weekend.
page.content: The following are brief accounts of the activities of some children during the weekend of 15th.- 16th. June,1985. "Quite a lot of people went to the Village Fete, held on the school playing field. There were competetions and stalls selling all sorts of things many made by the villagers or grown in their gardens. At the end of the afternoon there were running races for the children and a barbecue." "We went to the open day at Charlcote Water Mill." "On Saturday there was a gymkhana at Walton Hall, just down the road. I rode my pony in the Bending Race, the Flag Race, the Ride and Run and the Ball and Cane races." "It was my birthday and for a treat I was taken to the Royal International Horse Show. We saw show jumping stars Harvey Smith and his son Robert."
